Ridge MMM
  • Data Processor
  • View page source

Data Processor

The data processor module handles data loading, validation, and preprocessing for MMM.

Data processing module for Ridge MMM application.

This module provides the DataProcessor class for loading, validating, and analyzing marketing data.

class src.data_processor.DataProcessor[source]

Bases: object

A class for processing and validating marketing mix modeling data.

This class handles data loading, validation, quality checks, and statistical analysis of marketing data.

__init__()[source]

Initialize the DataProcessor.

load_csv(file)[source]

Load CSV file and return DataFrame.

Parameters:

file – File object from Streamlit file_uploader or file path

Returns:

Loaded data

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

Raises:

ValueError – If file cannot be loaded or is empty

validate_data(df, date_col=None, revenue_col=None, media_cols=None)[source]

Validate data for required columns and basic requirements.

Parameters:

  • df (DataFrame) – DataFrame to validate

  • date_col (Optional[str]) – Name of date column (optional)

  • revenue_col (Optional[str]) – Name of revenue column (optional)

  • media_cols (Optional[List[str]]) – List of media channel columns (optional)

Returns:

  • ‘is_valid’: bool

  • ’errors’: List of error messages

  • ’warnings’: List of warning messages

Return type:

Dict with validation results

check_missing_values(df)[source]

Check for missing values in the DataFrame.

Parameters:

df (DataFrame) – DataFrame to check

Returns:

Report with columns, missing count, and percentage

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

detect_outliers(df, columns=None, iqr_multiplier=1.5)[source]

Detect outliers using IQR (Interquartile Range) method.

Parameters:

  • df (DataFrame) – DataFrame to analyze

  • columns (Optional[List[str]]) – List of columns to check (if None, checks all numeric columns)

  • iqr_multiplier (float) – Multiplier for IQR (default 1.5 for standard outliers)

Returns:

  • ‘lower_bound’: Lower threshold

  • ’upper_bound’: Upper threshold

  • ’outlier_count’: Number of outliers

  • ’outlier_indices’: List of row indices with outliers

  • ’outlier_values’: List of outlier values

Return type:

Dict with outlier information for each column

get_summary_stats(df, columns=None)[source]

Get summary statistics for numeric columns.

Parameters:

  • df (DataFrame) – DataFrame to analyze

  • columns (Optional[List[str]]) – List of columns to include (if None, includes all numeric columns)

Returns:

Summary statistics (describe() output transposed)

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

convert_date_column(df, date_col)[source]

Convert date column to datetime format.

Parameters:

  • df (DataFrame) – DataFrame containing the date column

  • date_col (str) – Name of the date column

Returns:

DataFrame with converted date column

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

get_date_range(df, date_col)[source]

Get date range information from the dataset.

Parameters:

  • df (DataFrame) – DataFrame containing the date column

  • date_col (str) – Name of the date column

Return type:

Tuple[str, str, int]

Returns:

Tuple of (start_date, end_date, num_periods)

detect_data_format(df)[source]

Detect if data is single-market, multi-country, or multi-country-os format.

Parameters:

df (DataFrame) – DataFrame to analyze

Returns:

‘single’ | ‘multi_country’ | ‘multi_country_os’

Return type:

str

validate_multi_market_data(df, format_type=None)[source]

Validate multi-market data structure.

Parameters:

  • df (DataFrame) – DataFrame to validate

  • format_type (str) – Expected format (‘multi_country’ or ‘multi_country_os’) If None, auto-detects

Returns:

  • ‘is_valid’: bool

  • ’format’: str

  • ’countries’: list

  • ’os_platforms’: list

  • ’market_segments’: list

  • ’date_range’: tuple

  • ’issues’: list

Return type:

Dict with validation results

aggregate_data(df, level, filters=None)[source]

Aggregate data to specified level.

Parameters:

  • df (DataFrame) – DataFrame to aggregate

  • level (str) – Aggregation level: - ‘global’: Sum across all markets - ‘country’: Group by country - ‘os’: Group by OS - ‘country_os’: Keep country-os granularity

  • filters (Optional[Dict]) – Optional dict to filter data before aggregation e.g., {‘country’: [‘KR’, ‘US’], ‘os’: [‘iOS’]}

Returns:

Aggregated data

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

get_market_segments(df)[source]

Return list of unique market segments (country-os combinations).

Parameters:

df (DataFrame) – DataFrame with market data

Return type:

List[str]

Returns:

List of market segment strings (e.g., [‘KR-iOS’, ‘KR-Android’, ‘US-iOS’])

get_market_hierarchy(df)[source]

Return hierarchical structure of markets.

Parameters:

df (DataFrame) – DataFrame with market data

Returns:

{

‘format’: str, ‘countries’: list, ‘os_platforms’: list, ‘hierarchy’: dict # Nested structure

}

Return type:

Dict with market hierarchy

DataProcessor Class

Main class for processing marketing mix data.

class src.data_processor.DataProcessor[source]

Bases: object

A class for processing and validating marketing mix modeling data.

This class handles data loading, validation, quality checks, and statistical analysis of marketing data.

Usage Example

from src.data_processor import DataProcessor
import pandas as pd

# Create sample data
data = pd.DataFrame({
    'date': pd.date_range('2023-01-01', periods=52, freq='W'),
    'revenue': [10000 + i * 1000 for i in range(52)],
    'google': [5000 + i * 100 for i in range(52)],
    'meta': [3000 + i * 80 for i in range(52)]
})

# Initialize processor
processor = DataProcessor()
processor.load_data(data)

# Get media channels
channels = processor.get_media_channels()
print(f"Media channels: {channels}")

# Validate data
is_valid = processor.validate_data()
print(f"Data valid: {is_valid}")
